short_summary: Supply and installation of a portal crane for shipyard operations
description: The project involves the replacement of the A and B Jetty with new constructions that will require a rail-mounted portal crane for shipyard operations to support future ship maintenance and operations. A contractor will be required to provide, deliver, install, and commission a new portal crane for each location (A and B Jetty), including installation of power connection, onsite demonstration, training, and up to three years of maintenance and servicing.
full_summary:
# Tender Announcement for A/B Jetty Replacement Project

## Project Description

The Department of National Defence (DND) is undertaking a project to replace the two warships berthing facilities at the Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Esquimalt in British Columbia, Canada. The existing jetty structures, namely "A" Jetty and "B" Jetty, are to be replaced with new structures that will require the installation of new rail-mounted portal cranes for shipyard operations. Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is seeking a contractor to provide, deliver, install, and commission a new portal crane for each of the two locations (i.e., one crane for A Jetty and one crane for B Jetty).

## Services Required

The services to be provided by the contractor include:

* Provision of one new portal crane for A Jetty and one new portal crane for B Jetty
* Installation of power connection for the jetty cranes
* On-site demonstration and training
* Up to three years of maintenance and service of the cranes after substantial completion of each crane

## Timeline and Budget

The estimated total value of this project is $27,000,000 CAD. It is anticipated that the request for proposal (RFP) will be issued in the fall of 2023, contingent on contract approval by DND. The project is expected to commence on or around October 2023.

## Security Requirements

The successful contractor will be required to hold a valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) granted by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is sponsoring interested contractors to obtain the necessary security clearance(s) under its Industrial Security Program (ISP).

## Contact Information

For further information regarding this tender announcement, please contact:

Danielle Flynn
Coordinator, Contract Services
Defence Construction Canada
Telephone: (778) 789-3070
Email: Danielle.Flynn@dcc-cdc.gc.ca
